TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/StartPanel/MoreProgramsArrow extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of the **All Programs** arrow in the **Start** menu. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.StartPanel.MoreProgramsArrow class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the **All Programs** arrow.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.StartPanel.MoreProgramsArrow.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementStartPanelMoreProgramsArrow1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#216](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/72dddfba-2a8b-49f4-9e22-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#216](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/72dddfba-2a8b-49f4-9e22-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the **All Programs** arrow in the hot state.
Docs.value: A that represents the **All Programs** arrow in the hot state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Hot property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Hot property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementStartPanelMoreProgramsArrow2` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#217](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/0fcb8fd9-c926-4bde-a24d-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#217](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/0fcb8fd9-c926-4bde-a24d-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the **All Programs** arrow in the normal state.
Docs.value: A that represents the **All Programs** arrow in the normal state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementStartPanelMoreProgramsArrow1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#216](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/4fa13ffb-c417-405c-b0d8-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#216](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/4fa13ffb-c417-405c-b0d8-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the **All Programs** arrow in the pressed state.
Docs.value: A that represents the **All Programs** arrow in the pressed state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Pressed property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Pressed property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementStartPanelMoreProgramsArrow3` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
